TopicTitle: The Grass is Darker on the Other Side?

Articles.Content:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/ttdnpsl6cdjwxsf/KSP.log?dl=0

So the grass in KSC is darker thah usual what is causing this and how do I fix it?
Do you use any visual mods? In my experience anything that changes kerbin textures leaves the default KSC grass untouched.
Yeah, this looks like a common shadow bug, it (should) disappear if you wait it out.

Just now, Fisk02 said:

Yeah, this looks like a common shadow bug, it (should) disappear if you wait it out.

How long should I wait before proclaiming it a problem?

1 hour ago, Whovian41110 said:

How long should I wait before proclaiming it a problem?

I am not sure... The same thing have happened to me, for me it does not appear sometimes but sometimes it don´t.

That's the SM2 fallback terrain shader, you likely either disabled the SM3 terrain shaders in your settings screen, or your graphics card/driver are old and don't support SM3.

If it didn't look like this previously check your settings, and check that Windows has not rolled back your driver, you may need to reinstall the latest one.

27 minutes ago, sal_vager said:

That's the SM2 fallback terrain shader, you likely either disabled the SM3 terrain shaders in your settings screen, or your graphics card/driver are old and don't support SM3.

If it didn't look like this previously check your settings, and check that Windows has not rolled back your driver, you may need to reinstall the latest one.

Oh. I turned that off accidentally. Oops
